Spinach, feta & tomato slice

36 Comments

Email Print

Served hot from the oven for dinner, or cold for lunch, this creamy slice is a winner at any time of day.

0:35

To prep

 0:55

To cook

 11

Ingredients

 EASY

Difficulty

 6

Servings

 4.5

Average rating

(31 Members)
Rate this
recipe Add to
cookbook
Australian Good Taste

Australian Good Taste - November 2009 , Page 63
Recipe by Emma Braz

Photography by John Paul Urizar

  • Ingredients
  • Nutrition
Energy
1467kJ 		Fat saturated
14.00g
Fat Total
27.00g 		Carbohydrate sugars
4.00g
Carbohydrate Total
15.00g 		Dietary Fibre
2.00g
Protein
12.00g 		Cholesterol
161.00mg
Sodium
438.52mg

All nutrition values are per serve.

Add to my Shopping List
Shop Ingredients Now [?]
  • Method
  • Notes
  1. Step 1

    Preheat oven to 180°C. Brush a 26 x 16cm (base measurement) slice pan with oil. Line the base and sides with the pastry. Place in the fridge for 15 minutes to rest. Bake for 15 minutes.

  2. Step 2

    Heat oil in a medium non-stick frying pan over medium heat. Cook the leek and garlic, stirring, for 2 minutes or until the leek is soft. Spread over the pastry base.

  3. Step 3

    Cook the spinach in the frying pan over medium heat for 1 minute or until just wilted. Transfer to a plate lined with paper towel. Squeeze excess liquid from spinach. Arrange the spinach over the leek. Top with the feta and tomato.

  4. Step 4

    Whisk the egg, cream and parmesan in a large jug. Pour over the spinach mixture. Bake for 35 minutes or until firm.

Freezing tip Cool completely. Cut into 6 slices. Wrap each in plastic wrap. Freeze in an airtight container for up to 3 months. Eat hot or cold. To reheat after thawing, bake on a lined baking tray in oven preheated to 180&deg;C until heated through.

Find recipes that make the most of seasonal produce in our winter collection. You may also enjoy our curry and soup collections.
